sect1.title: FUNCTION Structure FUNCTION Structure

row.entry: The return value type of the function. If omitted, the type is implicit from the retval expression.

entry.para: The ECL attribute name of the function.

row.entry: The parameters to pass to the code. These are available to all attributes defined in the FUNCTION's code.
The local attribute definitions that comprise the function. These may not be EXPORT or SHARED attributes, but may include actions (like OUTPUT).
Specifies the function's return value expressionâ€”the retval.
The value, expression, recordset, row (record), or action to return.

sect1.para: The FUNCTION structure allows you to pass parameters to a set of related attribute definitions. This makes it possible to pass parameters to an attribute that is defined in terms of other non-exported attributes without the need to parameterise all of those as well.
Side-effect actions contained in the code of the FUNCTION must have definition names that must be referenced by the WHEN function to execute.
See Also: MODULE Structure, TRANSFORM Structure, WHEN
